tool.name: ExportAttachments

param.name: fc
param.dialogReference: Featureclass containing all attribute data for the photos. Can be a file geodatabase or a sync copy .goedatabase sqlte file pulled down from AGOL.

param.name: attachment_table
param.dialogReference: Related table that stores the BLOB image data. Usually has the same name as the featureclass with __ATTACH suffix.

param.name: field_list
param.dialogReference: List of fields that will be exported in the name of each photo. For example, if a field called "Condition" was selected, you will see Condition_Good.jpg or something similar as the output filename. Try to keep this just to fields you need, otherwise the file name can get huge.

tool.summary: Batch exports all photos from an ArcGIS Online feature service (if attachments are enabled). The attachment table is limited in information and all attributes about the photos are in the original featureclass of the project. In order to make this data useful during the export process, the featureclass attribute table needs to be made accessible via a pandas data frame and accessed with a lookup of the associated GUID. I've found the most success creating an offline sync copy of the project in Pro. This allows you to make edits to the attribute table and have an entire copy of the attachments locally. You will need to change this to reflect the path to the .geodatabase file made during sync.
